title: Good Morning Britain stars hungover after just TWO hours sleep following boozy night out
text:
Good Morning Britain stars hungover after just TWO hours sleep following boozy night out The team were 'blurry-eyed' after all-night celebrations for Kate Garraway's book launch Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Ben Shephard and Kate Garraway present GMB hungover Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The Good Morning Britain team turned up "blurry-eyed" for today's show after spending the night boozing to celebrate Kate Garraway's book launch. 
Host Ben Shephard was forced to apologise to viewers at home and asked them to "bear with us" as the hungover presenters tried to hold it together on screen. 
Opening the programme, Ben said: "We've made it, all a little bit blurry-eyed here on the desk this morning because we had quite a night last night." 
Fellow presenters Charlotte Hawkins and Piers Morgan, who was absent from the show today, also attended the event at Waterstones in London to launch Kate's first novel - The Joy of Big Knickers. Read More The presenters were looking a little worse for wear (Photo: ITV) Kate and her co-presenters had been celebrating the launch of her new book (Photo: ITV) 
Kate said: "We had a bit of a night, I had a little bit of a bash didn't I. 
"We're all amazed I can write something longer than a tweet." 
Ben cheekily replied: "To be fair you struggle with tweets most of the time." 
The host then revealed that the team only had two hours sleep, before he added: "Do bear with us this morning lots of coffee." Ben warned viewers that lots of coffee would be needed (Photo: ITV) 
Kate's new book is about the issues and positives of growing older as she approaches her 50th birthday. 
Ben admitted that he and Pier's had climbed inside a giant pair of Kate's pants, before they bantered about who had got the most drunk. 
Kate claimed she had been "good" with the amount of alcohol she had consumed, but Ben quickly replied "no you weren't." Read More Kate Garraway says sex marathon with husband came after chest pains and trip to A&E The team only had two hours sleep before starting at 6.00am (Photo: ITV) 
Paddy McGuinness even commented on the state of Kate after he invaded the studio pushing a trolley full of cakes to talk about Red Nose Day . 
The Take Me Out Host went over to give Kate a hug and a kiss, claiming he could "still smell the gin from last night". 
Paddy, who had interrupted Richard Arnold's entertainment section, then took a sniff of the orange juice and said: "There’s vodka in that, that’s an exclusive." Paddy thought he could smell alcohol on Kate (Photo: ITV) 
Viewers took to Twitter to both praise and slam hosts for continuing with the show. 
One Kate fan said: "@kategarraway wish I looked like you after a night of drinking you look amazing this morning xx" 
Another added: "@GMB Kate after all that celebrating the bags under your eyes are big enough to carry your knickers (joking) x" 
One unhappy viewer said: "GMB Kate and partner embarrassing today . They need taking off get more professional people on #BBC1 can show you how to do it" Like us on Facebook
